Sequence Information.Peptide Name: bLF 17â€“30 (Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of Lactoferricin B, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, lactoferrin fragment, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 56% similar toLactoferricin B. K=R: 21%, W: 14%.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli O157:H7 or K12 (MIC 1.8-1.9 uM), P. aeruginosa Pak (MIC 1.5 uM), A. naeslundii (MIC 10 uM), P.gingivalis HG 66 (MIC>100 uM),  Gram+ B. subtilis ATCC 9372 (MIC 10 uM), S. sanguis SK4 (MIC 5.5 uM), S. mutans (MIC 5.5 uM), and yeast C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 1.5 uM).MOA:fungi:C. albicans: acted on membranes.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: only hemolytic at high concentration close to 100 uM.
Literature Information.Author: van der Kraan MI, Groenink J, Nazmi K, Veerman EC, Bolscher JG, Nieuw Amerongen AV.2004
Literature Information.Title: Lactoferrampin: a novel antimicrobial peptide in the N1-domain of bovine lactoferrin.
